complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the setup into: (1) Create Git repository, (2) Scaffold Vite + React + TypeScript, (3) Install and configure Tailwind CSS with custom theme, (4) Add and configure Prettier, (5) Add and configure ESLint, (6) Ensure Node.js 20+ compatibility and document setup steps.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task is foundational but follows well-documented, standard patterns. Each tool (Vite, Tailwind, Prettier, ESLint) requires separate configuration and verification, and custom theming adds moderate complexity. Industry best practice is to modularize setup for maintainability and onboarding.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Connect repository to Vercel, (2) Configure staging and production environments with environment variables, (3) Set up Cloudflare CDN for static assets, (4) Enable automatic deployments on main branch push, (5) Document deployment and rollback procedures.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Deployment configuration involves multiple external services and environment management. Each integration (Vercel, Cloudflare, env vars) is a discrete step with its own risks and verification needs. Best practice is to isolate and document each for reliability and reproducibility.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose into: (1) Define color palette and typography variables, (2) Configure Tailwind for glassmorphism, gradients, and effects, (3) Integrate and test custom fonts, (4) Create utility classes for effects, (5) Set up Storybook for design tokens, (6) Render and verify sample components.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: A global design system impacts all UI and requires careful planning, configuration, and testing. Custom effects and typography integration increase complexity. Storybook integration is a best practice for visual regression and documentation.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: (1) Install and configure React Router v6+, (2) Define route structure for all layers/sections, (3) Implement breadcrumbs, (4) Add progress indicator, (5) Enable and test smooth scroll transitions.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Routing is a core architectural concern. Adding breadcrumbs and progress indicators introduces cross-cutting concerns. Each feature is best handled as a subtask for clarity and testability.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Build Campaign Launcher Form and Preview
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) Design and implement controlled form with validation, (2) Add sliders, dropdowns, checkboxes with Tailwind styling, (3) Implement real-time preview updates, (4) Integrate success animation with Framer Motion, (5) Write unit tests for validation and preview, (6) Document form usage and edge cases.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Dynamic forms with real-time previews and animations are moderately complex, requiring state management, validation, and UI feedback. Each input type and animation should be isolated for maintainability and test coverage.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Implement performance comparison graph, (2) Build winner highlights component, (3) Create ROI breakdown pie chart, (4) Develop trend predictions timeline, (5) Animate chart transitions, (6) Add export button visuals, (7) Test chart rendering and interactivity.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Multiple complex visualizations, each with unique data and animation requirements, increase cognitive and technical complexity. Export features and interactivity add further integration points. Best practice is to modularize each visualization.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose into: (1) Audit for alt text and ARIA labels, (2) Add focus indicators and skip links, (3) Refactor for semantic HTML, (4) Test with screen readers, (5) Test keyboard navigation, (6) Run Lighthouse and Axe audits and fix issues.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Accessibility compliance is a cross-cutting concern requiring code review, refactoring, and manual/automated testing. Each aspect (labels, focus, semantics, testing) is a distinct area per WCAG 2.1 AA standards.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: (1) Animate icons with Framer Motion, (2) Highlight ROI metric in neon green, (3) Implement 'Explore' button, (4) Integrate modal open/close with AnimatePresence, (5) Test all interactions and accessibility.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Interactive UI elements with animation and modal logic require careful state and accessibility handling. Each feature is a logical subtask for clarity and testability.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) Implement MetricCounter component, (2) Integrate Framer Motion for animation, (3) Apply JetBrains Mono font and styling, (4) Write unit tests for animation and accuracy.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Animated counters are a focused UI feature with moderate complexity, mainly in animation and accuracy. Best practice is to separate component logic, animation, styling, and testing.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Implement InputSlider component, (2) Add input validation and error handling, (3) Display current values beside sliders, (4) Persist inputs in LocalStorage, (5) Test validation, responsiveness, and persistence.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Input handling with validation, persistence, and real-time feedback is moderately complex. Each concern (UI, validation, persistence, testing) should be isolated for maintainability and reliability.
